Text: New Techs are available for research
Research cost of all Techs reduced
Translation: 全部科技的研究花費減少
疏濬者即將降落至地圖區塊 <u(value)>

Text: Another Dredger has landed on Mars
Translation: 另一支疏濬者已經到達火星
叛變的無人機正在攻擊

Text: Number Six has sabotaged the Explorer

Translation: 選擇一個地圖區塊掃描
選擇一個地圖區塊掃描
地圖區塊 <u(name)> 掃描完成

Text: No edible Food has been harvested
Translation: 此次收成 沒有任何可食用的作物

Text: There's more to the barren environs of the Red Planet than meets the eye - a veritable treasure trove of undiscovered knowledge and wonder… So long as you know where to look.
Translation: 這紅色星球並非只有眼睛看到的貧瘠環境 - 它是一個擁有尚未被發現的知識和奇蹟的寶庫 ... 只要你知道去哪裡找。

Text:
Even the tiniest, simply-looking rock can contain the answers to mysteries which perplexed the human mind for generations. Sometimes it takes just a simple discovery to assure us of the vastness of the Universe, an encouragement to make us look beyond the boundaries of our existence and into the future.

<effect> The following Techs have been revealed on the Research screen:
<list_text>
Translation:
就算是最小的， 看起來很簡單的石頭， 也可以解答困擾了人類幾個世代的奧秘。 有時候， 只需要一個簡單的發現， 就可以讓我們信服於宇宙的浩瀚， 鼓勵我們將目光超越自身存在的界限， 放眼未來。

<effect>研究面板上揭露了以下技術：
<list_text>

Text: The recent Colonist deaths are a worrisome trend which cannot be ignored!
Translation: 近期殖民者的死亡趨勢很令人擔憂 ， 不容忽視！

Text:
While the Applicants who came to Mars were aware of the many risks that would await them, the near-criminal neglect from our side is something different. We cannot keep this information from the public – and opinions are swaying in the direction that our Colony is a “death trap”.

This troublesome rumor deters many valuable candidates from coming to the new frontier – and these are people we desperately need to fulfill the great mission of colonizing Mars and bringing our vision of the future closer.

<hint> Each time a Colonist dies from a non-natural death, <ApplicantsLostOnColonistDeath> Applicants leave the pool.
Translation:
來到火星的應徵者警覺到有很多風險等著他們， 旦我們卻幾乎忽視這個事實。 我們無法對大眾隱瞞這個資訊 – 民意傾向於認為我們的殖民地是個 "死亡陷阱"。

這個令人困擾的謠言嚇阻了很多來到這個新邊境的珍貴候選人 – 而我們迫切的需要這些人來實現殖民火星的偉大任務， 帶領我們更靠近對未來的願景。

<hint> 每次當有殖民者死於非自然因素，<ApplicantsLostOnColonistDeath>應徵者將會離開

Text: Scientists and visionaries have promoted the idea of “Humanity as a multi-planetary species” as the only way to prevent a possible mass extinction.
Translation: 科學家和遠見者提倡 "人類殖民外星" 是唯一避免大滅絕的方式。

Text:
The dwindling resources on our planet, overpopulation and environmental crisis, as well as the risk of a global-scale Armageddon create a powerful argument for anyone doubting the importance of our mission.

It is a well understood fact that it’s a matter of “when” not “if” for a major extinction event to happen. Having a self-sustaining population on a world other than Earth when the time comes should drastically increase humankind’s odds of survival.

<goal><objective>
Translation:
我們星球上日益減少的資源 ，過盛的人口， 環境危機， 以及全球性的世界末日風險， 替質疑我們任務重要性的人提供了有力的論點。 

顯而易見的， 重大滅絕事件的發生是遲早的事。 在地球以外的世界有一群自給自足的人口， 可以在事情發生時， 大大增加人類存活的機會。

<goal><objective>

Text: We have to admit that we failed to accomplish one of the main goals set before our mission. Sadly, we underestimated the difficulties of sustaining a large population on the Red Planet.
Translation: 我們必須承認在火星任務執行之前設定的主要目標之一失敗了。非常不幸，我們低估了在這紅色星球上維持龐大人口的難度。

Text:
But this failure shouldn't throw us into despair. We still have to strive to create a stable, self-sustaining foothold from which humanity would reach the stars and conquer them.

<effect>Mission Evaluation objective failed - you have <count> Colonists out of <target> present on the planet. Final Score: <Score>.
Translation:
但是這個失敗不該讓我們絕望。 我們仍必須努力創造一個穩定且自給自足的立足之地，讓人類可以抵達外星球並征服它們。

<effect>任務評估目標失敗 – 目標殖民者數量為 <target> 而你擁有 <count> 個。最終分數：<Score>。

Text: As the Evaluation Day dawns upon us we can clearly say that the mission to Mars was a success.
Translation: 隨著任務評估日到來我們可以確信這次火星任務是成功的。

Text:
Even that we didn't surpass the expectations, the stable trends of development of the colony are encouraging.

Our achievement is still a tremendous success – we did something which no one imagined to be possible. The Colony would now be a symbol of hope and new beginning, a proof that humanity would persevere and live on regardless of the challenges we face.

<effect> Mission Evaluation objective completed - you have <count> Colonists out of <target> present on the planet. Final Score: <Score>.
Translation:
就算我們沒有超越預期， 但是殖民地的穩定發展趨勢仍鼓舞人心。

我們的成就仍然是相當成功 – 我們達成了大家都認為不可能的事。 殖民地現在會成為希望跟新開端的象徵， 證明不管我們面對甚麼挑戰， 人類還是可以存活。

<effect> 任務評估目標達成 - 目標殖民者數量為 <target> 而你擁有 <count> 個。 最終分數：<Score>.

Text: Congratulations! Everyone at Mission Control rejoices as the Colony has been marked as “extremely successful” in the Evaluation Report.
Translation: 恭喜！殖民地評估結果為「極度成功」，整個任務中心都沉浸在喜悅之中。

Text:
We managed not only to achieve our goals, but also to surpass all expectations as the size of our current Colony is far beyond the initial estimations. This day will be marked in human history by the importance of our accomplishment – we secured the future of humankind as interplanetary species. The Colony would now be a symbol of hope and new beginning, a proof that humanity would persevere and live on regardless of the challenges we face.

<effect> Mission Evaluation objective completed - you have <count> Colonists out of <target> present on the planet. Final Score: <Score>.
Translation:
我們不只達成了任務，整個殖民地的規模甚至大幅超越了當初的預估。我們今天的成就將被歷史記住 — 我們確保了人類將成為跨星球的物種。現在殖民地已成為希望的象徵與新的開始，證明無論面對什麼挑戰，人類將能存活下來並且延續下去

<effect> 任務評估目標達成 — 目標殖民者數量為 <target> 而你擁有 <count> 個。最終分數：<Score>

Text: Our civilization, in all its glory, still bears the mark of obsolete cultural and ideological beliefs, from times when people didn't know any better. If we remain ignorant of our own flaws we risk destroying the future for our children.
Translation: 我們的文明儘管看似輝煌，但在過去所知不足時，遺留下來的過時文化與思想主義仍然存在。如果我們繼續無視這些缺陷，則無異於將我們的未來與子孫的命運置於險處

Text:
New horizons open new possibilities. Mars can be viewed as a blank canvas – a hostile, uncultivated place where humanity can start anew. A fresh start needs new people – people born on Mars, raised in a society where people cooperate and fight the odds instead of each other.

<goal><objective>
Translation:
新的地平線開啟了新的可能性。 火星是一張空白的畫布 – 一個充滿敵意且未開墾的地方， 讓人類可以重新開始。 全新的開始需要全新的人們 – 在火星出生， 且在人們互相幫助爭取機會，而不是互相對抗的社會中成長

<goal><objective>

Text: The Mission Evaluation period is over and the progress we've made was marked as... sub-optimal, to say the least.
Translation: 任務評估期間結束， 我們的進展被標記為 ... 最少可以說是次優

Text:
Martian birthrate trends are still susceptible to malicious undercurrents and the Colony depends largely on the arrival of Applicants from Earth.

The Sponsors are disappointed that their program goal - a new human civilization on Mars - can't be achieved yet. Probably it was too early to expect that humanity can beat the odds of survival on such a hostile world and reach the level of everyday comfort required to start thinking about children and the future. The burden to disprove the evil tongues who would say this is impossible now lies on our shoulders. There's still work to be done

<effect>Mission Evaluation objective failed - you have <count> Martianborn Colonists out of <target> present in the Colony. Final Score: <Score>.

火星的出生率趨勢還是容易受到暗潮洶湧的惡意所影響， 殖民地大多還是依賴從地球來的應徵者。

贊助商對於計劃目標 - 火星上的新人類文明 - 還無法達成感到失望。 或許現在去期待人類能在這個險惡的世界中存活， 並達到可以開始思考孩童和未來的生活水準，還為時太早。 去反駁那些認為這件事是不可能的言論的重擔，現在落在我們的身上了。 還有很多工作要做

Text:
If we keep up the good work, in several generations the concept of the Martian civilization would exit the state of the hypothetical and become a reality.

任務評估： 一個全新的開始

Text: The Mission Evaluation period is over and it’s not wrong to say that we managed to outdo ourselves.
Translation: 任務評估期間結束， 我們可以說我們已經超越了自我

Text:
The number of Colonists born on Mars have reached beyond the wildest expectations! This solid base would serve us to promote new values of the new society, to allow the culture of the Red Planet to flourish and develop independent of the bad influence of Earth.

The path ahead of us is rough and uncertain, but who knows, maybe one day the people on Earth would admire the achievements of the Martians in awe, learning from them.

<effect> Mission Evaluation objective completed - you have <count> Martianborn Colonists present on the planet out of the target <target>. Final Score: <Score>.

火星之子的人數大大超越了預期！ 這個堅實的基地可以讓我們推廣新社會的新價值， 讓火星文化可以獨立於地球不良影響之外而繁榮發展。

我們前方的道路充滿了不確定性， 但是誰知道， 或許有一天， 地球人會敬佩火星人的成就， 向他們學習

Text: Humankind might be on the verge of a new Golden Age! And we have to be the ones who ride the crest of that wave!
Translation: 人類可能正在黃金時代的邊緣！ 我們必須成為騎在浪頭上的人！

Text:
A new era of scientific discovery is ahead of us and we are the ones who are blessed with the opportunity to be on Mars – a completely new territory where new scientific discoveries lie behind the corner. We’re talking about new ideas which would sweep the human minds and the market and give us a tremendous head start in the future.

The primary reason behind the creation of this Colony is scientific and this is what we’re expected to do – to push the boundaries of human knowledge!

Translation:
科學發現的新時代正在我們眼前， 而我們是那些有幸在火星上的人 – 科學發現的全新領域就在那裏。 這是一個會橫掃人類思維也橫掃市場的新想法， 帶領我們走向偉大未來的開端。

創造殖民地的主要原因就是科學， 這就是我們所期望的 – 推動人類知識的界線！ 

<goal><objective>

Text: At the end of the Mission Evaluation period we have to admit that the pursuit of technological progress on a hostile alien world is an unaccessible luxury, when we're preoccupied with short-term survival.
Translation: 在任務評估期間的終點， 我們必須承認， 當我們專注在短期的生存時， 在這充滿敵意的外星世界上追求科技進展是負擔不起的奢侈。

Text:
The harsh conditions of Mars proved too overwhelming and the technological leap desired is very far off.

The colony has proven its worth as a cradle of scientific thought and everyone is sure that the future is hiding more secrets to be uncovered and more mysteries solved.

Text: We are all descendants of those who dared to look beyond the nice, cozy valley they inhabited and enter a world full of mystery and wonder.

Our nature is one of discovery and novelty – our curiosity will never be satisfied. To this we owe much of our civilization’s prosperity and progress.

Exploring the mysteries beyond our world caters to the best in us and by capturing our collective imagination as a species, we bring the focus back to what we can accomplish together instead of bickering and fighting amongst each other.

<goal><objective>
The Mission Evaluation report confirms what we knew – the target goals were far off from the very beginning.

The planet turned out to be even more hostile and uninviting than we thought, thwarting any attempts to make a breakthrough in its exploration.

It seems that Mars will continue to be an uncharted territory for the next generations to explore. What matters now is to turn our failure into success by making sure that the Colony is a good starting point for these crews and expeditions that would set off into the red deserts to satisfy their wanderlust.

Text: Many things have been said about the nature of commerce. Some deem it unnecessary, even malicious and immoral, others defend the virtues of diligence and creativity it brings.

We aren't expected to enter such a hot philosophical debate. Our goal is far simpler, and yet complex, than that – to make sure that the money can flow between Mars and Earth.

Commerce is what drives civilization to advance and to prosper. Establishing the first interplanetary trade relations will, in our view, catapult civilization to new heights - and being on the forefront of it all won’t hurt!

<goal><objective>
The Mission Evaluation period is over and our mediocre progress towards the end goal jeopardizes the recognition of interplanetary commerce as a viable niche.

We could only hope that this is not the end and whoever reviews the concept of commercial mining on Mars would take into account the severe difficulties we had to face on the Red Planet. The Colony is still here, though, and we could just have enough media coverage to make sure the idea wouldn't be completely dismissed in the future.

Text: Mission Evaluation: The Pinnacle of Civilization
The Mission Evaluation is over – but the bright future is just ahead of us!

With the spectacular achievements of our mining and export endeavor there’s hardly anyone who believes that the concept of interplanetary commerce is a laughing matter.

The ample amounts of Rare Metals we’ve sent to Earth will make money flow towards Mars – and we all know that where money flows, people follow. Not many a generations would pass before the space between the Blue and the Red planets fills with the buys traffic of rockets carrying back and forth shipments and settlers.

A toast to that!

Text: Our attempts to penetrate the outer layer of the Sphere were unsuccessful, though they did yield some interesting results.
Translation:
我們的科學家在第一研究區現場的封鎖線內，持續地針對這個未知的球體進行一連串的實驗。
可惜今日的物理穿刺測試中，依然沒有得到任何有趣的結果

Text:
Whatever lies within the Sphere is pretty capable of harnessing any energy projected at it. Furthermore, the energy used by our instruments seems to have furthered its power-up process.

<effect>The Sphere charges a bit
Our test results tell us the Sphere accumulates energy by absorbing radio waves,
Translation: 在經過科學家們一連串的測試、統合報告後，雖然還無法斷定結論，但能確定是這個「球體」會吸收附近的反射波段

Text:
So thorough is the absorption process that we fail to detect even the slightest reflected wave being thrown back at us. Aside from that the Sphere remains, unsurprisingly, quiet.

<effect>The Sphere charges a bit
Translation:
我們很驚訝球體竟然可以將儀器所產生的反射波段吸收的一乾二淨，儘管科學家們對於這個結果議論紛紛，但封鎖線內，那黑色毫無光滑面的球體仍然不為所動，安安靜靜

<effect> 球體能量微幅增加

Text: I kinda hope it stays quiet
Translation: 希望"它"就這樣一直靜靜地待在那就好...

Text: Our running hypothesis seems to be correct. It’s releasing energy to charge faster. Maybe it’s alive?
Translation: 科學家們討論後，做了個大膽的假設：「如果球體可以快速地吸取能量，或許能量對它而言的一種"養分"，那麼"它"可能會是種生命體？」

Text:
While energy direction by itself is not something so unusual, utilizing it for a purpose implies intent or at least programming of some kind. Our current test-grade proof will most certainly help encourage our scientists currently tackling this mystery.
 
<effect>The Sphere charges a bit
Translation:
儘管這樣的能量行為守則，不符合當今科學理論，但科學家們反而對這顆球體產生更大的興趣，迫不急待地想探索球體內埋藏的秘密


<effect>球體能量微幅增加

Text: A short dig following an off-the-charts reading revealed a metallic spheroid buried just beneath the surface.
Translation: 在經過工程部門短暫的挖掘後，我們發現了埋藏在地表下的金屬球體

Text:
Its surface is perfectly smooth and also seems to sport mirror-like features.

The way this sphere reflects its surroundings has struck our team as being especially odd. It reflects not what one would expect, and in some instances seems to entirely ignore the observer from the reflection.   

This has the potential to be something monumental. Further excavation is most definitely encouraged by everyone here at Mission Control.

<effect> A half-buried sphere is revealed
Translation:
"它的表面出乎意料的光滑，看起來就像是一面鏡子"

球體的鏡面反射中，看到了科學家以及工程團隊們各個交頭接耳談論著，他們的神情看起來非常的興奮且好奇。

我馬上將這個消息回報給控制中心，而且很快地就得到回應：

「這項發現很有可能是一項重大突破，經過控制中心討論過後，一致決定繼續開挖，深入了解這個目標」


<effect> 發現露出於地表一半的金屬球體

Text: Keep me up to speed on any finds.
Translation: 我非常好奇還能發現些什麼

Text: We tried interacting with it, which triggered some sort of response. The Sphere isn’t dormant anymore.
Translation: 科學家們試著用各種方式，在球體上筆來劃去的，想測試看看是否能夠找出個什麼蛛絲馬跡，但突然的一陣微弱的顫動，球體似乎有了反應

Text:
Our most sensitive instruments detect a very weak, yet constant low frequency vibration, giving the Sphere a sort of hum. At least no harmful particles are detected. 

We will be waiting for further test results.

<effect>The Sphere begins charging.
Translation:
我們使用了殖民地上最先進的科學偵測儀器，在直觸式實驗監測的時候，發現球體產生一種很薄弱不尋常的震動模式，這樣的快速震動使得球體產生一種嗡嗡的聲響，尤其是當眾人瞬間都靜止時，那樣的聲音更額外令人刺耳。不過慶幸的是，目前看起來似乎沒有產生可能造成危險的狀況或物質。

<effect>球體開始充能中

Text: That’s some B-movie material right there.
Translation: 這玩意兒看起來真不現實，感覺就像是B級電影中會出現的東西

Text: Definitive contact with an extraterrestrial being, for the first time in the history of mankind.
Translation: 科學家們認為，這絕對是一個生命體，甚至斷言就是人類長久以來所談論的「外星人」，這絕對將會是人類歷史上最重大的發現之一

Text:
Mission Control was struck speechless as the half excavated Sphere finished the job itself and un-burrowed fully on its own, then began moving - levitating with the aid of some propulsion method unknown to us. 

Around it, temperatures fell drastically, creating a cold area that moved around with it. Mission Control is scrambling to predict where it’s headed to and if this cold zone is a byproduct of its propulsion method. Or more like its function. 

These are exciting times – scary, but exciting.

<effect>The Sphere begins moving.
Translation:
發生了不得了的事情！挖掘工作才進行到一半，球體本身竟然移動了起來，在沒有任何外力的協助之下，竟然以一種難以解釋跟形容的方式，"懸浮"在半空中移動著，待在任務監控中心的我們看著這個畫面，也呆住了。

瞬間，球體附近的溫度劇烈下降，就像是寒流那般瞬間創造了一個極度寒冷的環境地表。幸好地面上科學家跟工程部門的同仁們身上的太空衣都有配備標準恆溫系統，不至於有立即的危險。但看著球體周圍霜白的地面，在比較遠處紅塵滿滿山丘，真是一個強烈的對比。

一般來說，能夠瞬間創造如此巨大的寒冷環境，想必擁有非常巨大的能量才有辦法造成，物理學上表示能量越大，也對應的產生相當的熱量，但這玩意兒完全背道而馳！

雖然從來沒有看過這樣的狀況，但在控制中心的我還是非常的緊張興奮又帶點害怕，但現在似乎當務之急是趕快預測球體行進的方向，趕緊做預防措施

<effect>球體開始移動中

Text: The Sphere should be watched closely at all times!
Translation: 現在開始將全面派人24小時全天候監控著球體

Text: Spheres: The Sphere is a Sucker!
It seems to be absorbing any sort of electrical current in close proximity. In other words, it’s feeding on our batteries.
Translation: 我們發現電力相當的不穩定，電源指示器上一直處在於低電量狀態閃爍著，尤其是球體附近的電器幾乎快要無法作用！這球體正在吸取我們的電力！

Text:
While we aren’t sure if the Sphere has any set destination it is hovering towards, we have enough evidence to say that a new process has been initiated by the Sphere. For what purpose, we cannot say as of now.

<hint> The Sphere drains batteries and charges quicker.
Translation:
科學家們現在還沒辦法討論出個所以然，也不知道球體到底要往哪移動。球體似乎渴望著電力能量，似乎要發展或者執行什麼樣的動作，現在任務中心也是一個頭兩個大，還要面對上廁所頻頻斷電的窘境，我們得趕快想個辦法阻止電力的損失！

<hint> 球體正以非常快速的方式消耗著我們的電力

Text: The humming’s less than subtle now, with the added bonus that it’s clearly harming any Colonists that come too close.
Translation: 醫療部門向我報告，陸續湧進許多暈倒的殖民者緊急狀況，這時科學家也向我報告音頻量測結果，證實球體因顫動產生的低頻率聲響，對人體會直接的產生包含暈眩、嘔吐、劇烈心悸等影響！

Text: While it does not seem to be lethal in any moderate doses, any Colonist, subject to the Sphere’s influence, shows signs of deteriorating health and needs a solid few days at the Infirmary. Our researchers have several theories on what this phenomenon is and should we prioritize it, we may be able to come up with a way to protect our citizens from the harmful influence of any such Sphere. Sphere Protection research available.
Translation: 保安官跟我報告說，殖民地的人民議論紛紛，說這是天堂近了，有人說球體是「天體者」，是上帝派來用酷寒嚴冰來"重設"這顆星球，就像是地球那時的冰河時期、懲罰我們！ 雖然目前還未收到有殖民者引此喪命的狀況，但這樣的狀況確實影響球體附近的蒼穹頂下居民的健康跟理智，而且影響人數眾多，醫療部門的的病床完全不夠應付這樣的情形。 我們的科學家提出了主動式反向低頻抵銷的廣播設計，透過產生與球體反向的低頻功率，應該就可以把那聲響完全的消除，就跟靜音耳機的理論一樣。 我收到這樣的報告後馬上就批准了這個提案，並且通知工程部門盡快配合研發，用最快的速度給我生出來！ 天體者防護系統 可以研究了

Text: The safety of our citizens is always a priority!
Translation: 我們人民的人身安全永遠是優先考慮的事情！

Text: A Eulogy for an Everyday Hero
We gather here today to bid a final farewell to one of our finest.
Translation: 我們今天一起聚集在這，來向我們最好的朋友道別

Text:
As difficult and painful as it is, we must accept that <ColonistName(colonist)> is dead. As friends, as a community, we express our sadness, we acknowledge our loss, acknowledge the great importance of <ColonistName(colonist)>’s life.

<ColonistName(colonist)>’s life has been a journey towards a vision, a journey which brought us all towards the possibility of living on the Red Planet, one small step after at a time. <ColonistName(colonist)> didn’t try to make their mark in human history, for there is no room for attempts in success. <ColonistName(colonist)> knew what the calling of fate was, knew the risks and the opportunities and made the best of it, for the good of us all.

What is it that takes a person through all of this is a question only we can answer. This is a question whose answer is the spirit of <ColonistName(colonist)>, and this is a legacy for us.

<effect><ColonistName(colonist)> has died. Cause: <reason>
<hint> Each time a Colonist dies from a non-natural death, two Applicants leave the pool

As difficult and painful as it is, we must accept that <ColonistName(colonist)> is dead. As friends, as a community, we express our sadness, we acknowledge our loss, acknowledge the great importance of <ColonistName(colonist)>’s life.

<ColonistName(colonist)>’s life has been a journey towards a vision, a journey which brought us all towards the possibility of living on the Red Planet, one small step after at a time. <ColonistName(colonist)> didn’t try to make their mark in human history, for there is no room for attempts in success. <ColonistName(colonist)> knew what the calling of fate was, knew the risks and the opportunities and made the best of it, for the good of us all.

What is it that takes a person through all of this is a question only we can answer. This is a question whose answer is the spirit of <ColonistName(colonist)>, and this is a legacy for us.

<effect><ColonistName(colonist)> 去世了。 死因： <reason>
<hint> 每次當有殖民者死於非自然因素，就將會有應徵者會離開

Text:
<ColonistName(colonist)>, as every other Colonist, went through psychological conditioning before arriving on Mars to guarantee their most basic ability to cope with the adverse environment. Indeed, the people live on a barren, dead-cold world with a toxic, almost non-existent atmosphere, protected only by a fragile-looking Dome and relying on machines to keep them alive.

The unparalleled everyday stress levels slowly drain the people of their resolve – thus even the slightest shock or frustration can send someone over the edge. On Earth entertainment and recreation are just for fun, but here they are a tool for basic survival.

<hint> The Colonist <ColonistName(colonist)> has reached critically low Sanity. Provide operational Healthcare buildings in the Domes and avoid Heavy workload or Nighttime work to prevent this situation.
Translation:
<ColonistName(colonist)>，與所有其他殖民者一樣，在來火星之前都做了心理調適，以確保他們能夠適應火星艱困的環境。沒錯，這些住在火星上的人們僅僅依賴著這層又薄又脆弱的蒼穹頂保護著，而外面的環境貧瘠、又冷、空氣充滿著毒氣，更別提那能令人幾秒內窒息的稀薄大氣。

無法想像的壓力每天一點一滴的侵蝕著殖民者們的心智 – 也因此不論是多麼無關痛癢的小事都可能讓人們崩潰。在地球上，娛樂不會是人們會去多做聯想的活動，但在這裡娛樂卻是每個人生存下去所必需的活動一環。

<hint> 殖民者 <ColonistName(colonist)> 的理智即將斷線！ 請提供所在的蒼穹頂一些運作中的醫療建築，並且避免高壓工作或者 長時間 在大夜班工作

Text: Our Colonists are suffocating! We only have a few hours to get them more Oxygen before they run out!
Translation: 我們的殖民者們無法呼吸了！得快點想辦法，不然距離他們窒息而死只剩下幾小時！

Text:
Our Domes are large enough to contain tons of breathable air, but when the systems fail to refresh the supply, the amount of carbon dioxide will steadily increase until the atmosphere becomes unbreathable.

<hint> Colonists with the Suffocating status effect have no access to Oxygen and will die within a short time. Connect their Dome to operational MOXIEs and Oxygen Tanks or plant Oxygen-Producing Crops in Farms to supply them with Oxygen.
Translation:
我們的蒼穹頂能夠保存上噸的氧氣，但若供氧系統無法持續運作，二氧化碳的含量將會逐步提高，直到整座蒼穹頂都無法呼吸。

<hint> 殖民者感覺到窒息狀態，如果短時間內沒有提供氧氣的話，殖民者會很快的死亡。請確認您有可運作的氧蒐集站以及氧氣儲存槽等氧氣生產設施，並且正確與蒼穹頂的管線接口連結。

Text: The Colonists are on the brink of dehydration! We need to figure out something quick before they die.
Translation: 殖民者們正瀕臨脫水的邊緣。我們必須在他們死亡前趕緊做些什麼。

Text:
Water is the vital fluid which sustains all life. The human body requires a constant access to fresh, drinkable water and quickly deteriorates when none is present. Thus the extraction of Water is one of our utmost priorities.

<hint> Colonists with the Dehydrated status effect have no access to Water and will die within a short time. Connect their Dome to operational Water Producers or filled Water Towers to supply them with Water.
Translation:
水是維持所有生命體最基本的需求。人體需要持續補充新鮮的水，否則健康很快就會惡化。因此取得水是我們最優先要做的事情。

<hint> 殖民者若無法取得水將很快脫水，且很短時間內便會死亡。將生產水的設施或是擁有水的水塔連結至蒼穹頂以供給水。

Text: Our Colonists are suffering from hypothermia!
Translation: 我們的殖民者正因失溫而受苦著！

Text:
Domes feature heaters which maintain a pleasant temperature of 23 degrees Celsius around the clock, protecting against the fluctuating temperature of the fickle Martian atmosphere outside. The temperature inside the Dome quickly decreases when the power supply is cut and the Colonists sure do feel the effects. If the situation remains unchanged, I'm afraid that it could be fatal.

<hint> Colonists with the Freezing status effect reside in a Dome with an insufficient supply of Power. Increase the amount of Power accessible to the Dome to prevent this.
Translation:
蒼穹頂特有的加熱器能使其內部溫度全天候維持在宜人居住的攝氏23度，保護殖民者不受火星上變幻莫測大氣影響。當電力供應停止，蒼穹頂內的溫度將急速下降，而殖民者們肯定會立刻感受到影響。若情況持續不改善，這將可能致人死亡。

<hint> 蒼穹頂因電力不足造成居住其中的殖民者處於凍僵狀態。增加供給蒼穹頂的電力以避免此狀況。
我們的殖民者們正在挨餓！

Text:
Constant supply of fresh nutrients is vital to the survival of the Colony. The Colonists can go on for some time before they suffer more adverse effects from the lack of food, but if you don't feed them soon, they will die.

<hint> Colonists with the Starving status effect have no access to Food. Deliver Food from Earth or produce it by farming to supply the starving.
Translation:
讓殖民地存活下去的必要之一便是持續供給新鮮的營養食物。即使缺乏食物，在因為挨餓而受到副作用之前，殖民者仍可持續生存一段時間，但若不趕快解決這狀況，他們最終仍會死亡。

<hint> 殖民者們因無法取得食物而處於飢餓狀態。從地球運送食物或是自己耕種食物以解決此狀況。

Text: The day claimed our last living Founder, spelling the end of an era for us all.
Translation: 就在今天，我們最後一位存活的創始者，為我們劃下了一個時代終結的句點。

Text:
<ColonistName(colonist)> had a dream – to see humanity united, conquering the stars. And <ColonistName(colonist)> allowed nothing to stand in the path of this dream. No hardship, no loss, not even personal safety. What more can anyone be asked to do?

We had known many women and men of character, of strength and virtue. Any one of them might have stepped into <ColonistName(colonist)>'s place and we would be none the wiser. But we know why <ColonistName(colonist)> chose this path. When a heart as big and strong beats in one's chest it gives no other option but to follow its call.

When <ColonistName(colonist)> fell, it left a void. Do not let it take over your hearts, friends. Do not mourn the icon of good that we have lost, rather rise up and become the icon yourself. Let this death be not a blow against the will of humanity to grow, learn and conquer new frontiers.

<hint>The Founder <ColonistName(colonist)> died. Cause: <reason>.
Translation:
<ColonistName(colonist)>有個夢想 – 希望看到人類團結並征服這個星宇。而<ColonistName(colonist)>前往這夢想的路上不畏任何困難。沒有苦難，沒有損失，人們安居樂業。夫復何求？

我們認識具有各式各樣操守、氣度及美德的人們。我們無法如同他們般睿智，而他們之中的任何人都會與<ColonistName(colonist)>做一樣的決定。但我們知道<ColonistName(colonist)>為何選了這條道路。當內心深處有個聲響不斷敲打，不斷催促著的時候，我們唯有追隨著這個聲音勇往向前。

<ColonistName(colonist)>的逝去，讓我們內心多了個空缺。但朋友，別讓這空缺佔據我們的心靈。不要因我們失去的這位偉人而成天悼念，我們應該振作起來並成為像他一樣偉大的人。別讓他的逝去反變為對這個社會成長茁壯的打擊。

<hint>創始者 <ColonistName(colonist)> 過世。 原因: <reason>.

Text: Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night
Translation: 不要溫順地步入那良夜

Text: Today was a tough one. We lost one of our Founders.
Translation: 真不是好過的一天。我們失去了一位創始者。

Text:
We will all have our own special memories of the mark <ColonistName(colonist)> left in our hearts and in our lives. I am certain that <ColonistName(colonist)> would have wanted us all to be here today filled not with grief but with strength, vision and hope for the future. This is what <ColonistName(colonist)> lived for and doing otherwise would make this cause pointless.

We are all here today not only because <ColonistName(colonist)> laid down the foundations of our Colony. We were all personally touched and inspired by their strong character, personality and presence. We were all very lucky to have had <ColonistName(colonist)> beside us in both good and bad moments and, as much as will be missing our comrade, their memory will live on as long as we remain united.

<hint>The Founder <ColonistName(colonist)> passed away due to old age.
Translation:
<ColonistName(colonist)>的離去必定都在我們各自的生命裡留下了專屬回憶，我相信<ColonistName(colonist)>一定會希望今天在場的大家都能夠對未來充滿著勇氣、信心及遠見，而非哀傷。這正是<ColonistName(colonist)>活著時一直戮力所求的，而我們不該讓他的努力泡湯。

今天我們不單是因為<ColonistName(colonist)>為殖民奠定的基礎而站在這裡。我們也都因為他們堅韌的性格、態度而有所啟發。我們非常的幸運，不論是好或壞的時刻都有<ColonistName(colonist)>一路陪伴，儘管我們會想念他，但只要我們團結一致，他的精神將與我們長存。

<hint>創始者<ColonistName(colonist)>因年老而過世。

Text: Nobody Knows The Trouble I've Seen...
It's a rough life here on Mars. You can't prepare for addiction.

Despite the great lengths we go through to make it seem safe and as close as possible to home, one’s mind is never too far from the dangers that the privilege of being an interplanetary pioneer carries. We all find our own ways to cope with this pressure. finds it in the bottle. The Founder has the Alcoholic Trait.
Translation: Despite the great lengths we go through to make it seem safe and as close as possible to home, one’s mind is never too far from the dangers that the privilege of being an interplanetary pioneer carries. We all find our own ways to cope with this pressure. finds it in the bottle. 創始者 得到了 酒鬼 性格

Text: In Space, No One Can Hear you Whine
Translation: 在太空，沒有人可以聽到你在碎碎唸

Text: The Founders are supposed to be the pillars of the future Colony – destined to be remembered for generations.
Translation: 創始者們在殖民的歷史上，絕對值得留下一座雕下紀念他們的勇氣與精神

Text: For they are meant to tread and live where no man has ever lived before – in an environment not meant for man to live in to begin with. This is why it came as a shock to us all when turned out to be such a whiner! The Founder has the Whiner Trait.
Translation: For they are meant to tread and live where no man has ever lived before – in an environment not meant for man to live in to begin with. This is why it came as a shock to us all when turned out to be such a whiner! 創始者 養成了 愛發牢騷 性格
沒關係、那只是勇敢的另一種表現

Text: It takes more than bravery to be a pioneer of the Martian frontier. Or at least it should.
Translation: 要成為火星殖民的先鋒，需要的不只是勇氣而以

Text: They face uncertainty which no humans have faced before. on the other hand, albeit a pioneer, doesn’t seem especially brave and makes jumping in fright after seeing one’s own shadow look like a normal thing. The Founder has the Coward Trait.
Translation: They face uncertainty which no humans have faced before. on the other hand, albeit a pioneer, doesn’t seem especially brave and makes jumping in fright after seeing one’s own shadow look like a normal thing. 創始者 擁有 膽小 性格
建議建築：混凝土挖掘站

Text:
Many of the colony buildings require Concrete for their construction. Due to the heavy weight of the material continuous imports from Earth are not practical in the long run and we have to secure its production in the colony.

Concrete extractors must be placed over sulfur-rich regolith deposits - the yellow patches found often on the Martian surface. Like many other colony buildings, concrete extractors will require Power and regular maintenance from Drones.
Translation:
殖民地許多建設都需要使用到混凝土，但基於重量的考量，如果從地球上載運過來使用不但不划算，而且不會是個長久之計。所以我們必須可以在火星上製造混凝土。

混凝土挖掘站必須放置在看似黃白色紋路的資源地表上，建設時挖掘區域必須覆蓋與其上面才能進行挖掘。 混凝土挖掘站同時也需要電力以及無人機器的服務與維護。
生活總是參雜酸甜苦辣

Text: Building a new home on an alien world? That takes guts, to say the least.
Translation: 要在地球外蓋一個家？這絕對需要不少的勇氣阿

Text: After all, purpose is the strongest long-term driver. Since arriving on Mars, 's enthusiasm has proven to be above average, even by Founder norms, and the prodigious productivity displayed can be boiled down to one simple explanation – really loves doing what ‘s doing. The Founder has the Enthusiast trait.
Translation: After all, purpose is the strongest long-term driver. Since arriving on Mars, 's enthusiasm has proven to be above average, even by Founder norms, and the prodigious productivity displayed can be boiled down to one simple explanation – really loves doing what ‘s doing. 創始者 擁有 熱心 性格

Text: The first Colonists are all gamblers coming to Mars. It's the ultimate roll of the dice.
Translation: 躲的了一時躲不了一世、咱們在火星上首位好賭之徒出現了。

Text: They travel through 50 million miles to a rocky, inhospitable world and try to bend it to humanity's will. , on the other hand, seems to also be a gambler in the more traditional sense. We must not judge. On the contrary, we must be supportive and help our dear comrade with whom we’ve traversed the void, spearheaded humanity’s expansion on other worlds, only to find that we are no safer from vices so Earthly, it’s as if we never left. The Founder has the Gambler trait.
Translation: They travel through 50 million miles to a rocky, inhospitable world and try to bend it to humanity's will. , on the other hand, seems to also be a gambler in the more traditional sense. We must not judge. On the contrary, we must be supportive and help our dear comrade with whom we’ve traversed the void, spearheaded humanity’s expansion on other worlds, only to find that we are no safer from vices so Earthly, it’s as if we never left. 創始者 擁有 賭博 性格

Text: Living in cramped quarters, tinkering with intricate machinery day-in, day-out. There's plenty of opportunities for slip-ups.
Translation: 生活在這地域狹小的圓頂、每天忙到昏天暗地的，哪天康掉了也不意外

Text: Warning signs and instructions are, usually, enough to prevent most of them being done by most people. is not like most people and instructions and warnings seem to be of little to no use. We, as a small community, have come to accept the obvious: The Founder has the Idiot trait.
Translation: Warning signs and instructions are, usually, enough to prevent most of them being done by most people. is not like most people and instructions and warnings seem to be of little to no use. We, as a small community, have come to accept the obvious: 創始者 擁有 天兵 性格

Text: Mars has ways of crushing the hope out of our very best.
Translation: 無論懷抱多大的勇氣與希望，火星總是有辦法讓它破滅

Text:
The Founders had always been more than explorers and pioneers. They shared a vision of the future of the civilization on the Red Planet and worked ceaselessly towards their common goal.

But, as it often happens during the course of history the, societal standpoint changes. <ColonistName(colonist)> could not adapt to the changing times and decided to leave Mars. I know <ColonistName(colonist)> personally and I'm sure that this isn't caused by disappointment but instead is a rational decision. I remember one time when we talked about the future of the Colony and <ColonistName(colonist)>'s words: “We are the progenitors of the Colony but parents have to eventually step down and give way to their children.”

As I watch the rocket fly towards Earth I cannot force myself to think that <ColonistName(colonist)> is abandoning us. Something tells me that we will be in contact and will continue to receive wise council from our last Founder.

<hint>The last Founder <ColonistName(colonist)> has left Mars.
Translation:
The Founders had always been more than explorers and pioneers. They shared a vision of the future of the civilization on the Red Planet and worked ceaselessly towards their common goal.

But, as it often happens during the course of history the, societal standpoint changes. <ColonistName(colonist)> could not adapt to the changing times and decided to leave Mars. I know <ColonistName(colonist)> personally and I'm sure that this isn't caused by disappointment but instead is a rational decision. I remember one time when we talked about the future of the Colony and <ColonistName(colonist)>'s words: “We are the progenitors of the Colony but parents have to eventually step down and give way to their children.”

As I watch the rocket fly towards Earth I cannot force myself to think that <ColonistName(colonist)> is abandoning us. Something tells me that we will be in contact and will continue to receive wise council from our last Founder.

<hint>最後位創始者 <ColonistName(colonist)> 離開了火星

Text: The Mirror Sphere has Mission Control in total chaos. Though that’s expected given what we saw.
Translation: 天體者的謠言也傳到了控制中心，造成部分同仁開始相信這樣的傳言影響了士氣。雖然身為指揮官的我並不意外，畢竟外頭的一切真的是令人難以置信

Text:
In a moment of pure awesomeness the Sphere split into two identical Spheres. The new objects have grown to the exact same size as the previous one.

The second Sphere is now entirely independent from the first, moving in a direction of its own choosing, yet the two Spheres are clearly interacting with each other at a distance. Their humming frequencies are changing simultaneously and the more they resonate, the more a slight ionization of the atmosphere around them becomes evident.

At the moment of the splitting, vast amounts of data were gathered by our instruments, so we may have the means to dig deeper within this mystery. Until then we can only predict that some event will trigger when a certain resonance frequency has been reached by both Spheres.

<effect>The Sphere divided into two separate Spheres.
Translation:
就在這個瞬間，天體者在一陣巨大的聲響震動中，從看似影子的部分產生了另一個球體...，另一個尺寸外型顏色完全一模一樣的球體。

第二個天體者就這樣誕生了！而且似乎是有各自的思考方式與不同的前進方向，但又似乎可以彼此溝通著。兩個天體者對我們殖民地的影響更大也更加快速，我們的電力又開始劇烈的下降，部分設施瞬間失去動力，那令人不舒服的嗡嗡聲響又出現了！

在分裂的瞬間，我們的監控儀器收集到大量不尋常的數據，看起來似乎是當震動頻率與吸取能量的單位達到一個指標後，球體就會開始分裂成第二個球體，而新出現的球體也仍然在吸取著我們的電力...。

這真是個很糟糕的訊息！

<effect>天體者開始自體分裂成...兩個天體者
好了，這下看起來麻煩大了

Text: Those decoy buildings worked just like we planned, much to the dismay of our hardworking engineers. We've captured our first Sphere!
Translation: 誘餌建築的確有用！我們成功捕獲到第一支天體者了！原本緊張的控制中心響起了一片歡呼與掌聲！

Text:
Apart from controlling where it goes and what damage it does, this is of little use to us at the moment as we can’t dismantle them or even hinder their function in any way. 

However, this is critical for closer observation and research.

<effect> A Sphere is being held motionless.
Translation:
雖然目前我們沒有辦法摧毀天體者，但能夠控制它前進的方向，甚至阻止天體者的移動，已經是非常成功的第一步了！

現在我們的科學家可以更接近的研究觀察天體者了！

<effect> 一個天體者現在正無法動彈
天體者：來來來，喝完了這杯，再說吧

Text: Humanity applied its knowledge of an alien technology for the first time ever. And it was a complete success.
Translation: 人類有史以來，首次面對外星生物，並且從中研究獲得有助益的科技，這真令人興奮

Text:
The Sphere is converted back to its precious ingredients.

Our scientists are quick to inform us that any Sphere free from our decoy buildings will roll back to its splitting phase and will most probably try to retrieve the critical amount needed for their collective purpose.

We feel we have gathered enough information from these Spheres. It’s been deemed that decomposing all the Spheres is our best road of action.

<effect> A Sphere was converted into resources.
Translation:
"天體者可以被分解成有用的資源！"

我們的科學部門相當興奮地跟我報告這個消息，但同時也警告我如果電力供應不足的話，天體者將會從誘餌建築中脫逃，並持續進行分裂。希望我告知工程部門加緊完備我們的電力供應設施。

同時我們也將著手進行天體者注射解構的工程，希望這場災難可以趕快結束！

<effect> 天體者可以被轉換成有用的資源

Text: The Spheres just keep dividing. This level of technology… We can't even begin to comprehend it.
Translation: 天還未亮，副官就緊急的打電話進來，跟我報告天體者再次分裂，現在總共有三個天體者了！這已經遠遠超過我可以理解的範圍！

Text: The new Sphere also exhibits the humming of the previous two and is also resonating with them and the atmosphere around it. We have adjusted the predicted trigger point of the unknown event, as now it is expected to come earlier due to the higher Sphere count. The good news is that the more there are, the more observation material is available for our scientists. We should be able to paint a general picture of their purpose after investing some time to research them. Purpose of the Spheres research available.
Translation: 全新產生的球體與其它天體者一樣的特性，這也意味著我們的需要更多的電力跟抗低頻裝置來抵抗新天體者的危害。這次新天體者產生的時間比我們預期的還快，這不是個好現象，看來我的調整整個任務的行程跟預測週期，提前做好準備！ 好消息是，科技部門向我報告，球體前進的方向似乎受著某個可控制頻率影響，或許可以利用這一點，建造一個大型設施來引誘天體者進入，接著在.... 科技部門話還沒說完，我打斷的說： 「馬上批准，盡快聯絡工程部門協助，這是優先研究項目，還需要什麼資源立即向我彙報，我就地批准！」 引天入甕計畫 現在可以研究了

Text: Can’t decide if this is good news or bad.

What or who needs to lower the atmospheric temperature of contemporary Mars is beyond any of us – yet it is most evident that the Spheres are effective at what they are doing. If we want to stop the change, we must find a breakthrough based on what we already know and learn how to control or cancel this process. A prolonged, extremely strong Cold Wave has begun. Xeno-Terraforming research available.
Translation: 在踏上火星的時候，這邊的溫度就已經相當寒冷，人們的太空衣上如果沒有空調裝置的話，可能撐不了多久就會被凍死了。 現在天體者所散發的強烈低氣壓，造成環境溫度瞬間下降，這感覺就像是寒流襲入，而且還更加嚴峻！ 如果要阻止他們，我們必須想辦法研發出對應的科技，來控制氣候繼續惡化下去。 科學部門跟我報告，他們現在能確定的是「天體者」不再繼續分裂了，目前他們僅利用著大氣層中的能量維持住懸浮的狀態。似乎已經獲取足夠的能量造成質量結構變得結實。換句話說，他們似乎吃飽了！ 所以科學家們正在研究一種方式，試著逐步分解掉天體者結構體的注射劑 冰河時期已來到，更強烈的冷氣團即將到來 異星同位化注射劑 現在可以研發了

Text: This is now officially a fight for survival.
We’ve dismantled the last Sphere, yet our unease with the alien technology still lingers.
Translation: 我們成功的完成了最後一個天體者分解的工程，看著同仁們歡呼雀躍著，在我眼中卻是無聲的畫面。

Text:
The Cold Wave that had gripped our Colony has finally been dispelled. Temperatures have returned to the normal, cruelly cold levels we are used to.

Our scientists are confident that we have recorded and gathered all data necessary for making sense of this encounter in the coming decades. Also, they are confident that the Spheres themselves had overstayed their welcome. 

Keeping them around would have meant living with the ever-present danger of re-activating the endless Cold Wave once more, even if we had managed to find a way to halt it without destroying all the Spheres. 

And despite the risks, despite the purely pragmatic reasons for destroying all the Spheres, one can’t help but wonder how the generations to come will feel of this deed. Will we go down in history as cowards? Or maybe as too insensitive to the magnitude of the encounter, the very first non-man-made technology ever found?

When our scientists give up on trying to determine the origin of these Spheres, will textbooks mention that because of the rash actions and fears of the few pioneers that lived on Mars at the time, the riddle will never be solved?

<effect> No more Spheres are left.
<effect> Cold Wave dispelled.
Translation:
壟罩在咱們殖民地的酷寒嚴東終於散去，恢復到正常的氣溫氣候。

我們的科學家們在這次事件中，蒐集到許多人類幾百年來無法得到的資料與答案，但對於「天體者」是否為善意的出現，我們都不認為，天體者的出現與帶來的災難，可能正是對人類的一種警告，我們不能忽略。

探索科學的好奇心是人類與生俱來的本能，尤其是在火星殖民的任務中更加顯得重要，殖民者大多都是一群嚮往著火星這顆紅色星球的地球人，才會參與這次的任務。但人類在宇宙中還是極度的苗小，還有太多我們未知的事物是我們無法用科學解釋的事情。

在地球，我們破壞了保護地球的臭氧層，造成劇烈氣候的發生，因此而喪命的地球人不計其數。來到了另一顆星球我們仍然沒有學到教訓，這次事件天體者所帶來的極度寒流，瞬間將殖民地帶入冰河時期的殘酷，也不正是跟我們在地球所受的報應一樣嗎？

經過這次事件，人類應該思考在好奇宇宙的奧妙同時，也不要忘了對自然界的尊敬，否則下次所帶來的影響可能就不是人類可以控制的後果了。

<effect> 天體者已不復存在
<effect> 寒流已完全消散

Text: Mods are player created software packages that modify your game experience. USE THEM AT YOUR OWN RISK! We do not examine, monitor, support or guarantee this user created content. You should take all precautions you normally take regarding downloading files from the Internet before using mods.
Translation: 模組皆為玩家自由創造與發揮的，這可能會改變您的遊戲體驗。當您使用這些模組須自行承擔可能的風險。我們不對針對模組進行任何的支援、觀察、檢視修改與風險承擔等！所以您必須在下載安裝模組前，請務必確切了解這些模組的來源與內容。

Text: Are you sure you want to delete the savegame <savename>?
Are you sure you want to overwrite <savename>?
Not enough space to create savegame <savename>!
Translation: 儲存空間不足，無法儲存遊戲 <savename>!
存檔時發生無法預期的錯誤！ <savename>

Text: Full of hope and determination, the first Founders have set foot on the Red Planet.
Translation: 帶著滿滿的希望與決心, 第一批創始人已經踏足火星.

Text:
The next 10 Sols will be full of difficulties and dangers, but also with great promises and opportunities. It is now to us to prove that Mars can be a doorway to greater riches and the future of the human civilization. Even the most epic adventures begin with a single step.

<effect> Arrival of additional Colonists temporarily suspended until the Colony proves able to sustain human life. Your Founder Colonists must survive for 10 Sols before additional people can arrive.

<hint> The Colony will be evaluated positively before the period ends in the event the first human is born on Mars. If you feel you are up to the challenge, try constructing a Medical Building and raising the Comfort of the Founders as much as possible with Service Buildings.
Translation:
接下來的十個太陽日內除了充滿著困難與危險，但也帶來了希望與機運。現在正是我們證明火星是延續人類繁華文明的時刻。千裡之行，始於足下。

<effect>接下來將暫時無法招募新的殖民者，除非殖民地證明能延續人類存活下去。 創始者們必須在接下來的10個太陽日內存活，以再請求客運火箭的支援。

<hint> 如果在評估到期前，誕生了首位火星之子，殖民地的評估將獲得相當正面的支持。若您認為已準備好接受挑戰，您可以考慮建設醫療建築，以及服務設施以提高創始者的舒適度。
第一個蒼穹頂建造好了！

Text: It's been a stellar day. Not just for the mission, but for humanity itself.
Translation: 幹的好啊！這個任務的完成將會是人類前往火星殖民的重要關鍵

Text:
Sol <day> of our mission will be remembered. Our greatest project to date has been completed – the Dome is ready to harbor the first Colonists on Mars. We, the team at Mission Control, are honored to be among the ones chosen to mark the beginning of a new age.

We created a place for humanity to call home, a place which reminds us of Earth. The Dome seems so fragile, like a glittering snow globe resting among the red sands. This makes us wonder – will our future be just as fragile? Would we be able to leave our cradle and thrive on this cold, distant world?
For the first time, a human has been born on Mars. It's truly a unique miracle.
Translation: 有史以來人類第一次出生在火星上。 這真是個獨一無二的奇蹟。

Text:
The Colonists have always felt like a family. But what makes the family stronger and more united is the promise of new life and better future. We have truly been blessed with a rewarding responsibility – to carry the torch of hope.

Let this blooming of life serve as a symbol for all humans. Mars is no longer a dead world.

<effect> The Colony has been evaluated positively. Additional Colonists can be called from Earth.
Translation:
The Colonists have always felt like a family. But what makes the family stronger and more united is the promise of new life and better future. We have truly been blessed with a rewarding responsibility – to carry the torch of hope.

Let this blooming of life serve as a symbol for all humans. Mars is no longer a dead world.

<effect> 殖民地的合適評估已經通過了，將可以繼續向地球請求客運火箭

Text: This will go down in history.

The long-time dream of the human civilization as a whole – to settle another world – has come true. To be among the people who made this happen makes me feel enthusiastic and proud.

We are already swarmed with applications for relocation on Mars and the wanderlust and enthusiasm of these people makes me proud to be a human being. The Red Planet continues to be inhospitable and even dangerous but we as a species had always displayed the ability to adapt and improve – the adverse conditions will only make us try harder. So I say bring it on!

<effect> The Colony has been evaluated positively. Additional Colonists can be called from Earth.
Translation:
The long-time dream of the human civilization as a whole – to settle another world – has come true. To be among the people who made this happen makes me feel enthusiastic and proud.

We are already swarmed with applications for relocation on Mars and the wanderlust and enthusiasm of these people makes me proud to be a human being. The Red Planet continues to be inhospitable and even dangerous but we as a species had always displayed the ability to adapt and improve – the adverse conditions will only make us try harder. So I say bring it on!

<effect> 殖民地的合適評估已經通過了，將可以繼續向地球請求客運火箭

Text: Looks live we’ve got a serious adventure ahead of us!
Translation: 看來將有更多嚴酷的挑戰等待著我們呀！

Text: Are you sure you want to cancel the Rocket’s launch order?
Translation: 你確定要取消火箭的發射命令嗎？

Text: Are you sure you want to exit the game?
There is not enough storage space. Delete old save data or disable Autosave from the Options menu.
Translation: 儲存空間不足。請刪除舊的存檔資料或是從選項選單中的選項中取消自動存檔功能。

Text: The save data limit for this game was reached. Delete old save data or disable Autosave from the Options menu.
Humanity had such high hopes and we failed them. We failed the Founders. But is this really the end?
Translation: 人類給予我們高度期待，然而我們卻失敗了。我們也辜負了創始者失望，但一切真的結束了嗎？

Text:
Failure's just another step in the process. The only thing is to dust ourselves off and try again. And when the future generations return to Mars, our experience, our mistakes and achievements will help them succeed where we could not.

<effect> All Founders have either died or left Mars. The Colony couldn't live up to the dream of human colonization. Game over. But don't give up!
Translation:
失敗只是過程中的一小步。唯一的辦法便是拋去過往並再次嘗試。當後世回到火星之時，我們的經驗、錯誤與成就將幫助他們在我們未能抵達之處獲得成功。

<effect>所有創始者皆已死去或離開火星，殖民地無法達成人類殖民火星的夢想。遊戲結束，但別放棄！

Text: The Colony has failed. The lives and the dreams of our Colonists are lost, washed away by despair and grief.
Translation: 殖民計劃失敗了，殖民者們的夢想與生命被悲傷與絕望的情緒洗去。

Text:
Now, our goal as a species is to not despair. To not look away from the stars. The path has proven to be hard and rocky, but hardship had only made humans more determined – and that’s what defines us as a species! We are sure that one day people will walk the red sands and call Mars their home.

<effect> All Colonists have either died or left Mars. Game over. But don't give up!
Translation:
身為人，現在我們決不能絕望。不要讓目光移開這星海，這條路雖然遍布荊棘，但苦難只會使我們更加堅定，這也是我們做為人的原因！總有一天，人們會走在紅色沙土上，並稱火星為家。

<effect>所有的殖民者皆已死去或離開火星，遊戲結束。但別放棄！

Text: Everyone at Mission Control is impatient to see the rocket touching down and unloading its precious cargo - our remotely controlled eyes and hands on the Red Planet - the drones and rovers. Our goal is to secure a foothold for humanity by building the first Martian Dome. This daunting endeavor will allow the brave pioneers - the Founders - to settle on Mars and prove that the colony is sustainable. But until then we have to make sure the colony has enough construction resources, Water, Oxygen and Power. Mission Sponsor: Commander Profile:
Translation: 任務中心的每個人都迫不及待看到火箭登陸並卸下寶貴的物資，那是我們在紅色星球的活動替身：無人機和漫遊者。我們的目標是建造第一座火星蒼穹頂好建立人類的橋頭堡。這項艱鉅的努力將讓我們勇敢的先鋒們，也就是創始者們，能夠在火星上定居並證明殖民計劃是可行。但在此之前，我們必須確保殖民地有足夠的建築資源、水、氧氣和電力。 任務贊助商： 指揮官簡介： 建議目標： #製造燃料使火箭可以往返補給 #尋找穩定的水資源，並儲存於水塔 #製造氧氣，並儲存於氧氣槽 #足夠的金屬與混凝土與一些進階資源 #建造蒼穹頂與人類需要的設施 #載運首批殖民者創始人踏上火星，壯大殖民地

Text:
Welcome to Surviving Mars!

Before you get started, please take a moment to read our Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.
Translation:
歡迎來到火星！

在您開始之前，請花點時間閱讀我們的使用條款與隱私政策。

Text: Read the Terms of Use (opens a web browser)
Translation: 閱讀使用條款（開啟外部瀏覽器）

Text: Read the Privacy Policy (opens a web browser)
Translation: 閱讀隱私政策（開啟外部瀏覽器）

Text: I agree to the Terms of Use and the Privacy Policy
Translation: 我同意使用條款與隱私政策。

Text: I do not agree to the Terms of Use and the Privacy Policy
Translation: 我不同意使用提款與隱私政策。

Text: You’d think the Explorer had found buried treasure, the way our scientists were reacting. It was a sulfur-rich regolith!
Translation: 你肯定認為探索者號找到寶了，咱們科學家也是這麼想的，這是塊富含硫磺的大地！

Text: The Explorer vehicle gathered various soil samples from far and wide around the Anomaly site and fed us the data. For hours, the telemetry was filled with buzzing chatter as the scientists at Mission Control discussed the implications of the element and made inventive plans about the future. The time of the expedition was limited and we urged them to make a final decision.
Translation: 探索者號收集來自觀察點週遭的土壤樣本，並為我們提供數據。幾個小時以來，遙測中心滿是嗡嗡響的人聲，因為任務中心的科學家們討論著這些數據的意義，並準備對未來做出開創性的計劃。考察時間有限，我們催促他們作出最終決定。

Text: Concentrate effort on gathering as many samples as possible. (<research(1000)>)
Focus on geochemical analysis of the most Sulphide-rich samples. (Engineering research boost: 10%)
Translation: 致力於在地質化學分析裡富含最多硫化物的樣本。 （工程研究加速： 10% ）

Text: We’ve got bad news. The RC Explorer investigating the anomaly accidentally released a pocket of high-pressure gas.
Translation: 我們得到了壞消息，探索者號在探勘觀察點的過程中意外釋放了一處高壓氣體帶。

Text:
The carbon dioxide erupted, damaging the rover and lifting tons of fine dust into the atmosphere, forming a Dust Devil. The Red Planet reminded us how dangerous an alien world could be.

<effect>Expect fierce Dust Devils to form at the Anomaly location.
Translation:
二氧化碳噴發破壞了探測車並將大量灰塵帶入大氣中，形成了一個塵捲風。火星它提醒了我們外星世界是多麼危險。

<effect>預期有強烈塵捲風在觀察點形成。

Text: The readings told us it was a vein rich with ore, but the data turned out to be incorrect. Under those fine red sands lay the intact hull of a rover.
Translation: 探測器讀數顯示這是一片富含礦藏的礦脈，結果錯了。在那純淨的赤沙下埋有一臺完整的探測車殘骸。

Text: We immediately recognized it – Curiosity. A historic finding that stretched its hand in a welcoming gesture through the years back to the first missions on the Red Planet. It belonged in a museum, but on the other hand was an opportunity to gain more parts that we could rarely get our hands on. It was a tough decision.
Translation: 我們馬上就認出了，是好奇號！在多年後的首次火星任務中，這個歷史性的發現以歡迎的姿態伸出它的手臂。它應該要擺在一間博物館裡，但另一方面這是一個使我們能夠獲得以前難以獲取的經驗之時刻。這真是個艱難的決定。

Text: Send Curiosity back to Earth. (<funding(500000000)> Funding)
Translation: 將好奇號送回地球。 （<funding(500000000)>資金）

Text: Display it as a monument in the Colony. (Social research boost: 10%)
Translation: 將它以紀念碑的形式展示在殖民地中。 （社會研究加速： 10% ）

Text: Our initial spectrographic analysis confirmed it. Chromium. To find such a rich deposit of such a rare metal. Important was an understatement.
Translation: 我們開頭的光譜分析中確認了，是鉻。竟然尋找到這麼豐富的稀有金屬蘊藏，而且如此輕而易舉。

Text: The geological team couldn't wait to get their hands on the samples, but this was going to prevent the engineering team from smelting the materials for their ceaseless operations. The experts at Mission Control argued for hours, but the course of action was clear.
Translation: 地質團隊迫不及待想要拿到樣品，但這會讓工程團隊無法冶煉這些物質好來繼續他們馬不停蹄的建設工作。控制中心的專家爭論了好幾個小時，但行動方向很明顯。

Text: Study the Chromium deposit. (Engineering research boost: 10%)
Translation: 研究鉻資源點。 （工程研究加速： 10% ）

Text: Exploit the deposit. (deep Rare Metals deposit)
Translation: 利用該資源點。 （獲得地下深處的稀有金屬資源點）

Text: Someone joked we found kryptonite. It was because of the greenish-yellow hue of the beryl crystals.
Translation: 因為找到了這些黃綠色的翠綠結晶體，有人開玩笑說我們找到了氪星石。

Text:
The contrast with the red Martian dust made them appear almost alien. Even if they wouldn't make any of the Colonists superhuman, they would surely give us almost supernatural powers!

Our plans at Mission Control included the introduction of a long-term nuclear energy solution for the growing Colony, and the Beryllium that we would produce from these minerals would be an immense help in this difficult mission. We would encase the nuclear fuel rods of our nuclear reactors in Beryllium and make a good use of its incredible mechanical, chemical and nuclear properties.

<effect>The Technologies in the Physics tree gain a 10% Boost.
Translation:
和火星上的紅色粉塵相較之下它們簡直是外星物質，儘管它們無法讓殖民者變成超人，但也肯定會給予我們近乎超自然的力量！

任務中心的計劃中預計為日益擴張的殖民地引入長期核能解決方案，我們從這些礦物中製造出的鈹將為這項艱鉅的任務提供莫大的幫助。我們將把鈹製燃料棒裝進我們的核反應爐，並充分利用其驚人的機械、化學和核物理特性。

<effect> 物理科技樹的科技獲得 10% 加速。

Text: The rover manipulators held the silver-white mineral up to the camera just as the chemical analysis came through. We’ve found Tellurium.
Translation: 經過化學分析後，探測車將它夾有銀白色礦物的機械臂舉在鏡頭前，我們發現了碲！

Text:
In a moment, the Chief Engineer at Mission Control was at the communications station, urging instructions to the RC Explorer on how to handle and analyze the discovery. It was amusing to watch the almost childlike excitement in the eyes of the expert.

This is a significant discovery because it allows us to overcome an old problem in metallurgy. Easily-machinable metals allow for economical manufacturing of components, but the factors that allow it usually lower their performance, and vice versa. Thus, engineers had always been challenged to find ways to balance the two factors. The addition of Tellurium to iron alloys allows them to perform better in both areas.

<effect>The Technologies in the Robotics tree gain a 10% Boost.
Translation:
和火星上的紅色粉塵相較之下它們簡直是外星物質，儘管它們無法讓殖民者變成超人，但也肯定會給予我們近乎超自然的力量！

任務中心的計劃中預計為日益擴張的殖民地引入長期核能解決方案，我們從這些礦物中製造出的鈹將為這項艱鉅的任務提供莫大的幫助。我們將把鈹製燃料棒裝進我們的核反應爐，並充分利用其驚人的機械、化學和核物理特性。

<effect>物理科技樹的科技獲得 10% 加速。

Text: Get up close and personal with Mars and you’ll find it’s anything but barren. We found another treasure in the form of a small deposit of a Germanium-rich mineral.
Translation: 親身與火星接觸時，你可以在他身上找到很多東西，雖然大部分沒什麼用。我們找到寶了，是一處富含鍺元素的礦物資源點。

Text:
The purity of the Germanium found in the vein is amazing, which our scientific team presumes is due to the millennia-long loss of volatiles in the Martian atmosphere.

Germanium started out as the humble ekasilicon proposed by Mendeleev and for almost a century it was discerned as a useless metal, only for late 20th century discoveries to make it one of the cornerstones of modern electronics.

<effect>Discovered Rare Metals deposit.
Translation:
這個富含高純度鍺的礦脈非常驚人，我們的科學小組認為這是因為火星大氣中的揮發物長期揮散造成的現象。

一開始被門得列夫稱作粗糙的「類矽」，幾乎一個世紀以來它都被認為是種沒有價值的金屬，在二十世紀晚期的發現才使它成為現代電子學的基礎之一。

<effect>發現稀有金屬資源點。

Text: The probe’s drill had hit one hundred meters before it detected a spike in temperature. The data tells us it was ignited Magnesium compounds.
Translation: 探測器鑽頭在鑽探了一百公尺深之後偵測到高溫，資料顯示那是被點燃的鎂化合物。

Text:
We are still waiting for confirmation but the preliminary results are clear. There are signs of chemical burning, indicating a combustible material in contact with the probe. The mechanical friction of the drilling head must have ignited the magnesium. What a great discovery!

Scientists on Earth had long planned the creation of jet engines that could burn the carbon dioxide in the Martian atmosphere with the use of magnesium powder. With abundant amounts on site, the research teams could begin preliminary testing of a working prototype right away!

<effect>Tech Boost (10%) for all Robotics Technologies.
Translation:
雖然仍有待證實，但初步結果很明顯地，有燃燒反應證明有易燃物質與鑽頭接觸。鑽頭的高速摩擦肯定點燃了鎂，多麼重大的發現！

地球上的科學家早已計劃製造可以在火星大氣中用鎂粉點燃二氧化碳的噴射引擎。由於該區有足夠的鎂，研究團隊可以馬上對原型機進行初步測試！

<effect>所有機器人學科技加速 10% 。

Text: Until today, the only place we’d thought you could find Ice XV outside of a lab was on an icy planet or a moon. And here we find it. On Mars.
Translation: 我們一直認為能在實驗室外找到的「冰15」肯定是在一顆冰冷的行星或衛星上。直到今天，我們竟然在火星上找到它。

Text:
Ice XV is a super-dense phase of water ice which is formed in extremely cold and extremely high-pressure environments. It turns out that the unique geological history of Mars allowed a small quantity of Ice XV to form under the crust.

Even though we didn't confirm any substantial deposits of water, this discovery would cause uproar in the scientific communities and draw significant attention to our efforts on the Red Planet. Our sponsors immediately provided us with tools to discover more about the effects of Martian geology on the formation of underground ice.

<effect>Gain <funding(500000000)> Funding.
Translation:
冰15是一種在極冷、極高壓環境下形成的高密度水冰，它證明了火星獨特的地質演化允許冰15在地殼底下形成。

儘管我們尚未證實有豐富的水資源存在，但這個發現將會在科學界引起軒然大波，並對我們在火星上的努力給予高度關注。我們的贊助商立刻為我們提供了更多工具，好讓我們繼續探索火星地質是如何影響地下冰的形成。

<effect>增加 <funding(500000000)> 資金

Text: We’ve just confirmed the location of a metal-rich deposit. A drilling accident turned to our advantage.
Translation: 我們剛剛確認了一處富含金屬的資源點，一場鑽探意外竟帶來了好運。

Text:
We lost a drilling probe while trying to analyze this Anomaly. The signal was suddenly lost and we got the tingling feeling that we would get lucky with the second one. The operators were extra careful and the second insertion revealed a vast network of underground cavities beneath the hard rock plate. On top of that, we managed to get in contact with the first probe which had fallen through in another section of the crust faults. We used the two probes as triangulation points for telemetry and pinpointed the location of the deposit.

<effect>Discovered a Metal deposit.
Translation:
在試圖分析觀察點時我們失去了鑽探機。信號突然消失，但我們卻因此感到興奮：第二臺機器也許會帶來好運。操作員小心翼翼，在第二次鑽探顯示硬岩盤下方有一處龐大的地下洞穴群。最重要的是，我們成功地找回掉落到地殼斷層裡的第一部探測機。我們將兩部探測器作為測量三角點，確定了資源點的位置。

<effect>發現金屬資源點。

Text: The on-site data validates our predictive models of the electrically-charged dust devils.
Translation: 現場實測結果驗證了我們的帶電塵捲風的預測模型。

Text:
Science is well aware of the causes of the massive Earth storms, monsoons and tornadoes and yet we never ceased to admire the primeval forces unleashed before our eyes. The same goes for Martian electrostatic dust storms. Our scientists already had a good working model on the behavior of these peculiar weather Anomalies on the Red Planet. Now we can refine this model even further. With the current expedition complete, we can confirm their theory, yet I doubt anyone would ever cease to revere the massive dust storms.

<effect>Gain <research(2000)>
Translation:
儘管科學已充分解釋到地球風暴、季風和龍捲風的形成原因，卻不能阻止我們對眼前的原始之力的讚嘆，火星上的靜電沙塵暴也是如此，我們的科學家對於這些火星上的奇特天氣現象已經有運作良好的模型，現在我們可以進一步完善這個模型，並在現階段的考察完成後證實他們的理論，但我認為任何人都不會停止對如此大規模沙塵暴的敬畏。

<effect>增加 <research(2000)>

Text: The Anomaly turned out to be one of the most well-preserved asteroid impacts in our area. No geologist could ever put a price on it.
Translation: 觀察點被證明是這個區域中保存最好的小行星撞擊區，沒有地質學家可以估計它的價值。

Text:
Earth scientists had long wondered about the effect of ancient asteroid impacts on Martian climate and geology. Several missions had been sent to gather data about these primordial events but the landers failed, as if the Red Planet wanted to keep some of its secrets for itself. Generations had to pass until we managed to send a successful expedition to lift the shroud of mystery.

With the data we gathered from the site, our colleagues on Earth will have material for years of research. Maybe we would finally find out whether the Martian core was shut down or it died out on its own, and we would be able to predict the destiny of our home world.

<effect>You gain <funding(800000000)> Funding
<effect>You gain <research(3000)>
Translation:
地球的科學家長期以來一直想知道過往小行星對火星氣候與地質的影響。先前已有幾架登陸器被派遣來執行任務，收集這些原始事件相關數據，但最終失敗了，彷彿像是火星想為自己保留一些秘密一樣。時間流逝直到我們成功地派出了一隊考察團，才揭開它的神秘面紗。

透過我們從該地區收集的數據，地球上的同事能獲得素材好繼續他們多年的研究。也許我們最終能知道火星地核究竟是被關閉還是自行消逝，而藉此我們將能夠預測我們故鄉的命運。

<effect>增加 <funding(800000000)> 資金
<effect>增加 <research(3000)>

Text: We've just found Beagle 2. Or at least what’s left of it.
Translation: 我們找到了小獵犬2號，應該說它存在的證明。

Text:
Over the years over two-thirds of the missions sent to Mars ended in disaster. The tragic course of events, attributed to bad luck, human error, or simply to the inevitability of shooting blind in the dark, had created a dark humor revolving around the Great Galactic Ghoul which feeds on exploration probes and the mystery of the Martian Triangle.

One of the best-equipped probe missions to Mars was Beagle 2, which failed dramatically in the last minutes before landing. Failed by the parachutes and the treacherous Martian atmosphere, the brave little probe crashed at fatally high speed against the red desert.

<effect> Gain Tech Boost (10%) to all Robotics Technologies.
Translation:
多年來，派往火星的任務有三分之二因為運氣不佳、人為因素，或單純因為降落在陰暗處而以失敗告終，如此悲劇甚至被幽默地敘述成由一隻以探測器為食的「火星暴食獸」引起的，也被稱作是火星上的「神秘三角洲」。

準備最充分的火星探測任務之一是小獵犬二號，然而它在著陸前一刻失敗了。降落傘的失效以及變化莫測的火星大氣，我們的探測器勇敢地在紅色沙漠上以高速墜毀。

<effect> 所有的機器人學科技加速 10% 。

Text: Begin analysis on the crash site.
Translation: 開始對撞擊點進行分析。

Text: We’ve analyzed material from the Anomaly and it completely validates our hypothesis on abiogenic petroleum!
Translation: 我們分析了觀察點中的物質，發現它完全支持我們對無機石油的假設！

Text:
The pocket of natural gas we discovered deep among the hydrocarbon rocks was nothing short of an evidence of petroleum formation. The geophysicists here, at Mission Control, stare at the research data in disbelief. Mars, even in its alien nature, has proven once more a teacher in the mysteries so well veiled on our home world.

This unique opportunity allows us to gaze into the past of Mars and gather knowledge which would take months to simulate inside a laboratory.
Translation:
我們深入烴氣岩中發現的天然氣囊正是石油形成的證據。任務中心的地球物理學家難以置信地盯著研究數據。火星，即便是顆不同於地球的行星，仍被證明可以是解開我們的原生世界中諸多秘密的指導者。

這獨特機會使我們能夠凝視火星的過去，並蒐集到以往需要幾個月才能在實驗室內模擬的知識。

Text: Conduct on-site volatiles experiments. (Physics research boost: 10%)
Translation: 當場進行揮發性實驗。 （物理研究加速： 10% ）

Text: Conduct on-site polymerization experiments. (Engineering research boost: 10%)
Translation: 當場進行聚合實驗。 （工程研究加速： 10% ）
賣掉科學資料。 （<funding(500000000)> 資金）

Text: It’s not every day that we have the luxury to choose from what Mars has to offer.
Translation: 並不是每天都有機會在火星提供的奢侈中選擇。

Text:
The planet constantly reminds us of its old habit – to give with one hand and take with the other. The rover came across coffinite rocks rich in uranium, clustered on top of a rich hematite deposit. The mineral veins were positioned in such a manner inside the rock that we couldn't blast through without compromising some of them.

We faced a difficult decision, but at the end, it was a matter of simple pragmatics.
Translation:
這個星球不斷地提醒著我們它的老特性：有得必有失。探測車探測到富含鈾的矽酸鹽礦石分布在豐富的赤鐵礦脈上。礦脈以這樣的方式嵌在岩層裡，以致我們無法避免地要破壞它們來取得那些物質。

我們面臨一個困難的決定，但到最後也只是個簡單的語用學問題。

Text: Exploit the Hematite vein. (rich Metals deposit)
Translation: 開發赤鐵礦脈。 （豐富的金屬資源點）

Text: Exploit the Uranium vein. (Rare Metals deposit)
Translation: 開發鈾礦脈。 （稀有金屬資源點）

Text: The analysis tells us that we’ve found Iridium-rich sulfides! That’s a real rarity on Earth!
Translation: 分析顯示發現了富含銥的硫化物！這在地球上超級稀有！

Text:
Mankind's ingenuity had found a myriad of applications for it. But we focused our plan on a much simpler, more vital role in our growing Colony – RTGs. Free energy for everyone!

<effect>Tech Boost (10%) to all Physics Technologies.
Translation:
人類的智慧早為此物質找到無數的應用方式。但是為了日益擴張的殖民地，我們將埋首於更簡單有效的計劃：那就是建造放射性同位素熱電機。讓大家享有免費能源！

<effect> 所有的物理科技加速 10% 。

Text: The Rover went dark for five hours. When it rebooted, it confirmed it had come into contact with an unusually high-voltage electrical charge.
Translation: 漫遊者號停機了五個小時，當它重啟後發現自己接觸到一處不尋常的高壓電荷。

Text:
The red alert was sounded immediately after we lost contact with the RC Explorer vehicle. Five long hours of fear and desperation ended with the reinstating of data feed. A wave of relief passed through the crowd of scientists gathered at the control center. The telescopic drill used to probe the crust at the Anomaly site disturbed a layer of magnetite-rich rocks, the source of the electric charge. The rover is still functional but it would take time before its locomotion systems are fully restored. The operators turned the defeat into a victory, devoting the unexpected time window to studying the magnetic properties of the Martian crust.

<effect>The RC Explorer has malfunctioned. It has to be repaired by Drones.
<effect>Tech Boost (50%) granted to the following technologies: Low-G Drive (faster Drones and Rovers), Autonomous Sensors (Sensor Towers require no Power or Maintenance).
<effect> Gain <funding(200000000)> Funding.
Translation:
紅色警報在我們與探索者號失去聯繫後立刻響起。長達五個小時的恐懼和絕望在數據送返的時候結束，聚集在控制中心的科學家們終於鬆了一口氣。電荷起因於探測觀察點地殼的鑽探機擾動了一處富含磁鐵礦的岩層。漫遊者號仍然可以正常運作，但在完全恢復機能前需要一點時間。操作者化危機為轉機，利用意外的空檔研究火星地殼的磁性。

<effect> 漫遊者號發生故障。 它必須由無人機修理。
<effect> 以下科技研發加速 50%： 弱G科技：越野火星（無人機和漫遊者速度更快）、掃描塔自主化升級（不再需要電力與維護）

Text: We’ve just found the wreckage of Phobos-2! The old probe even had some new data for us to analyze.
Translation: 我們找到了火衛2號的殘骸！即便是老舊的探測器也會有些新資料可以分析。

Text:
On July 7th, 1988 the Soviet Union launched two Proton-K rockets carrying the Phobos-1 and Phobos-2 probes on a course to Mars. Of the two craft only Phobos-2 reached its final destination, but contact with it was lost just before it could deliver its precious payload.

Humankind will be forever grateful for the information we salvaged from its computers.

<effect>Locations of several Anomalies discovered.
<hint> Check the map for the new locations.
Translation:
1988年7月7日，蘇聯向火星發射了兩枚質子Ｋ型火箭，運載了火衛一號和火衛二號探測器。其中只有火衛二號火箭到達目的地，但就在它可以提供其寶貴的有效載荷之前即失去音訊。

人類將永遠感激這些我們從電腦中獲取的資訊。

<effect> 發現數個觀測點。
<hint> 在地圖上查看這些新地點。

Text: Our Explorer just got into a pretty serious accident. The good news is it’s still in one piece.
Translation: 我們的探索者號遇到了些嚴重事故，好消息是它還完好無缺。

Text:
The vehicle stumbled upon a crust fault which could have lasted for a couple hundreds of years under the slow erosion of the planet. Disturbed by the mechanical motion of the scanning probes, the surface opened like a wound and swallowed the rover, luckily, only for a dozen of meters. The sturdy machine got out of the hole, but nevertheless it sustained heavy damage.

Millions of years ago Mars had been shaken to its core by cataclysmic impact which sealed the fate of the planet. Since then Mars, like all giants, is dying, too slow for our mortal eyes to witness. Yet even today the death-throes of the Red Planet can be felt unmistakably.

<effect>The RC Explorer has malfunctioned. It has to be repaired by Drones.
Translation:
它偶然發現了一個地殼斷層，在星球緩慢的侵蝕下可能已存在數百年。受到掃描探鑽頭運作的影響，其表面像傷口一般打開並吞噬了探測車。幸運的是， 堅固的機器自行從洞中脫困，但仍然受到嚴重破壞。

數百萬年前，火星因為地核受到災難性影響而注定了它的命運。從那以後，火星如同其他巨星一樣逐步走向死亡，不過我們短暫的生命無法見證它的死亡。然而即使在今天，紅色星球的死前掙扎也可以毫無疑問地感受到。

<effect> 漫遊者號發生故障。它必須由無人機修理。

Text: We’ve found signs of native life!
Translation: 我們找到來自本地的訊號！

Text:
The sensor reading from the Anomaly site provided the answer to one of the biggest mysteries about Mars. The Explorer examined a mineral cluster and found the preserved remains of microscopic life forms. We've managed to confirm that the deposit originated on Mars and not on one of the many asteroids that pockmark the surface of the planet.

The team is ecstatic with the find. If there was past life on Mars, perhaps we are not alone in the universe!
Translation:
來自觀察點地區的感測器讀數為火星最大的謎團之一提供了解答。探險家調查了一個礦物帶，發現了微生物形式的活動遺跡。 我們要設法證實這一礦區源於火星自身，而非那些襲擊星球表面的小行星。

團隊對發現感到欣喜若狂。如果過去火星上有生命活動的跡象，也許我們在宇宙中並不孤單！

Text: Publicize the find as a triumph of the Mars mission. (<funding(choice_param1)> Funding)
Translation: 將這個發現宣傳為火星任務的重大勝利。 (<funding(choice_param1)> 資金)

Text: Publicize the find as a triumph of humankind. (<choice_param2> Applicants)
Translation: 將這個發現宣傳為人類的重大勝利。 (<choice_param2> Applicants)

Text: We found some useful material in the debris from a small meteorite.
Translation: 我們在軌道上的一顆小型殞石上發現一些有用的物質。

Text:
After minimal processing, the resources can be transported and put to good use for the benefit of the Colony.

<effect> We discovered 30 Rare Metals at the Anomaly site.
Translation:
初步的探索後，這些資源可以運送到殖民地，並獲得妥善的利用。.

<effect> 在觀察點發現30單位的貴重金屬。

Text: We’ve discovered a magnificent vista at the site of the anomaly.
Translation: 我們在觀察點區域發現壯觀的景致。

Text:
Even after watching the cold splendor of the Red Planet for so long, Mission Control was awestruck by the beautiful footage provided by our intrepid reconnaissance vehicle.

<effect><reg_param1> new Applicants are available on Earth.
Translation:
儘管已經看了這麼久冷冽壯麗的紅色星球，但任務中心被我們無畏偵察車所提供的美麗景象驚呆了。

<effect> 地球上有 <reg_param1> 位新的應徵者。

Text: Let's hope we never tire of this beauty!
Translation: 希望我們永遠不會對這番美景感到倦怠！

Text: We’ve collected valuable geographic data at the site of the Anomaly.
Translation: 我們在觀察點附近蒐集到寶貴的地質數據。

Text:
Analysis of the crust yielded rare insights on the geological history of Mars, especially about the ancient Theiikian period, in which volcanic activity released immense amounts of sulfur dioxide in the atmosphere. Several key hypotheses of the exo-geologists were confirmed by our findings.

The scientific community praised the findings, raising the status of our mission in the eyes of humanity. Our sponsor committed additional funds to the mission.
Translation:
地殼分析為火星的地質史，特別是Theiikian時期，活躍的火山活動釋放大量的二氧化硫氣體到大氣中，提供了了珍貴的見解。 我們的發現證實了外星地質學家的幾個關鍵假設。

科學界讚揚了這些發現，提高了我們的任務在人類眼中的地位。我們的贊助商向任務單位提供了額外的資金。
獲得兩座無人機中心預製建築。
獲得四座水氣蒐集站預製建築。

Text: The odd composition of the debris collected from the anomaly site has proven to be an uncrackable riddle for our science team.
Translation: 這個從廢墟蒐集來的奇怪化合物被證明是我們的科學團隊無法解開的謎團。

Text:
The experts all agree that the materials discovered at the Anomaly site could not originate on Mars, but they are also in agreement that they are not the remains of a meteorite or a contaminant introduced from our Rockets. For now it looks like the origin of the debris will remain a mystery.

As wise men throughout history said more than once: the more we know, the more we realize that we don't know.

<effect> A Genius Applicant is available on Earth.
Translation:
專家一致同意這個在觀察點附近發現的材料不可能來自火星，但他們也同意這不是殞石或火箭帶來的汙染物。這碎片的來源目前看來還是一個謎。

正如歷史上的智者們不止一次說過的那樣：我們越知道，我們越認識到我們不知道。

<effect> 一個地球上的天才應徵者可供選擇。
沒什麼事情比的上一個謎團！

Text: Though initially fruitless, we recalibrated the operating spectrum for our scans and voila!
Translation: 雖然最初沒有結果，但在我們重新校正了掃瞄範圍之後，看！

Text:
The unusual chemical composition of the regolith near the Anomaly site effectively shielded it from our data gathering. As we re-purposed and improved our scanning technology based on these new findings, we were rewarded with an unexpected surprise.

<effect>Large Water deposit discovered.
Translation:
觀察點附近土壤的化學成分非常有效地阻止我們蒐集數據，當我們根據這些新發現重新定位和改進掃描技術時，我們獲得了意外的驚喜。

<effect>發現大型水資源點。

Text: There were no secrets to find near the Anomaly site, just a scene of breathtaking beauty.
Translation: 觀察點附近沒找到什麼秘密，只有一幅令人窒息的美景。

Text:
Such photo-ops have proven to be useful for the mission, inspiring people on Earth to believe that humanity should create its new home on the Red Planet.

<effect> A Celebrity Applicant is available on Earth.
Translation:
這些攝影作品被證明對這項任務有用處，它激勵地球上的人們相信人類應該在紅色星球上建立新的家園。

<effect> 一個地球上的明星申請者可供選擇。

Text: We discovered unusual crystals in the remains of a meteorite. The magnified images of their crystalline matrix were broadcast by every major news channel on Earth.
Translation: 我們在隕石之中發現了異常的結晶體，它結晶狀母岩的放大圖在地球上各大新聞頻道播出。

Text:
One tabloid even claims that the crystal is in fact artificially created - some kind of artwork of a microscopic alien race.

"The work resembles million tiny cylinders surrounded by flames. If you squint your eyes, the very static of the composition resembles a star map. The image is bordered by double rainbows while the work has an abstract feeling and a very dynamic structure."

While all this unscientific sensationalism had outraged our experts, the publicity provided us with some unexpected benefits.

<effect>You gain <funding(reg_param1)>.
Translation:
一個八卦小報甚至聲稱：結晶體實際上是人造的，來自於某種顯微鏡可見的外星種族。

「這玩意兒像是數百萬個由火焰包圍的迷你圓柱體。當你瞇起眼睛，靜態的構圖就像一張星圖，整幅圖像被兩道彩虹包圍，它有著抽象且動感的構成。」

雖然這些既煽情又不科學的言論激怒了我們的專家，但也為我們帶來了一些意想不到的宣傳效果。

<effect>你增加 <funding(reg_param1)> 資金。

Text: The Explorer made a thorough scan of the Anomaly site but couldn't find anything unusual.
Translation: 探索者號掃描了觀察點周遭卻沒找到什麼異常。

Text: Regrettably, it appears that the unusual readings were just a sensor glitch.
Translation: 很遺憾，看來異常讀數是掃描器故障造成的。

Text:
The RC Explorer is a robust, yet complex machine. Those unacquainted would be astonished when they see the mission reports where dozens of minor breakdowns happened during an expedition and were ignored by the operators. Expedition veterans know that a dead light bulb won't break down the vehicle and they ignore it with a wry smile.

But when something as serious as the motor system breaks down, it takes bravery not to panic. There is no time for desperation then, our drones have to repair the malfunction before it causes more harm.

<effect>The RC Explorer suffered a malfunction. It has to be repaired by Drones
Translation:
探索者號是台勇健但複雜的機器。那些外行人如果看到任務報告肯定會大吃一驚，因為在考察期間它發生了幾十次故障，但被操作者忽略。探險隊老鳥們知道，一個燈泡壞了不會對車輛造成影響，所以他們選擇苦笑以對。

但若是像機電系統故障那樣嚴重事故發生時，勇敢點，別驚慌。我們沒時間絕望，我們必須在無人機受到更多傷害之前修好它。

<effect>探索者號發生故障。它必須由無人機修理。

Text: As with everything made by the hands of man, the Explorer isn’t without its breakdowns and failures.
Translation: 就如所有出於人類之手的東西，探索者號是會故障和失效。

Text: We should research the Dark Spectrometry technology to learn more about the Black Cubes
Translation: 我們應該研究黑暗光譜技術，好更深入了解黑立方。

Text: A peculiar black cube matrix has appeared near the Colony. We should send an Explorer to investigate.
Translation: 殖民地附近出現了一個奇特的黑色立方矩陣體。我們應該派一個探索者來調查。

Text: An unknown black, previously undetected cube-shaped object
Translation: 這是個以前未被發現到的黑色立方體形物體。

Text: Reportedly, a black cube has appeared within the extractor.
Translation: 據報導，黑立方出現在挖掘器周遭。

Text: A Concrete Extractor went abruptly silent. Maintenance requests were met with nothing but static.
Translation: 一個混凝土挖掘站突然失去聯繫，提出修復請求也沒有回應。

Text:
This event was unlike any malfunction predicted in the security protocols. Orbital scans on the site revealed no evidence of the existence of the huge structure – only a black cube matrix centered on the spot where the extractor was supposed to be.

<effect>A Concrete Extractor has been destroyed by a Black Cube. An Anomaly has appeared on the site.
Translation:
這個事件與安全紀錄中預測的可能故障都不相同，衛星掃描顯示本應該存在的大型建築結構已然消失，只有一個黑色的立方體矩陣立在原本該是挖掘站的地方。

<effect>一座混凝土挖掘站被黑立方摧毀，該地區出現一個觀察點。

Text: A Black Cube has led to the destruction of a Concrete Extractor. We should investigate the site with an Expedition.
Translation: 一個黑立方摧毀了我們的混凝土挖掘站，我們必須派遣考察隊去調查那個地區。

Text: Power of Three: A Black Cube Appears
A routine scan of the perimeter has detected an unidentified object within immediate proximity of the Colony. Data logs confirm it – it isn’t a glitch.
Translation: 例行性掃描偵測到殖民地附近有個不明物體。數據紀錄顯示：這不是個小故障。

Text:
The mysterious object appears to consist of pitch-black cubes arranged in a matrix. The cubes seemingly levitate above the ground without the aid of any support structure.

Preliminary image analysis remains inconclusive. An on-site investigation is required to assess the Anomaly. We advise caution.

<effect>A Black Cube has appeared seemingly out of nowhere. We have to investigate this Anomaly.
Translation:
神秘物體看起來由排列成矩陣的漆黑立方體組成，它看起來浮在地面上，不須任何外力支撐。

初步的影像分析仍然充滿不確定性，還需要進行現場調查好評估這個異常的情況，我們建議謹慎些。

<effect>黑立方似乎無所不在，我們必須調查這個觀察點。

Text: Power of Three: ...For, They Came in Numbers
The mysterious cubes continue to appear across the colony. Mission Control advises all personnel to remain calm and stick to protocol.
Translation: 整個殖民地持續出現神秘立方體，任務中心建議所有人員保持冷靜並堅守工作流程。

Text:
The cube structures tend to emerge without warning, as unscientific as it may sound, out of thin air. Apart from their evident presence, so far the structures pose no threat to the Colony.

Until further investigation, the scientific board of Mission Control has decided to impose an information blackout on the matter to prevent the spread of panic and fear among the Colonists.
Translation:
立方體結構多半無預警的現身，聽起來不科學，但它是憑空出現的。除了它的存在很顯眼之外，到目前為止對殖民地並沒有構成威脅。

在進一步調查之前，控制中心的科學委員會已決定對此消息進行封鎖，以防止驚慌和恐懼在殖民者間蔓延。

Text: There is a certain sense of urgency to this, it seems.
Translation: 這看起來，的確有緊迫感。

Text: More than a hundred cubes have appeared. Their purpose and origin are still unknown.
Translation: 超過一百個立方體出現了，目前無法得知他們的來源與目的。

Text: Power of Three: Making Sense of the Unknown
We can’t hide the truth from the public, not when the Colony’s being swarmed by black cubes.
Translation: 當殖民地被黑立方給包圍之時，我們就再也無法對公眾隱瞞真相。

Text:
Without any credible explanation, the Colony was soon flooded with various rumors and interpretations of the mystery. What if they're bombs? Billions of tiny bombs? Or transport capsules maybe, with a mini robot inside. Or deadly hard drives. Or alien eggs? Or messages needing decoding. Or they're all parts of a bigger whole. Jigsaw puzzles that need to be put together.

The team at Mission Control is against trying to spread further misinformation and propaganda – partially because it would just add to the total confusion, but mainly because it would endanger the philosophical principles of our mission. We could only trust in our Colonists and hope for the best.
Translation:
殖民地很快就充斥著對謎團的謠言和猜想：他們會不會是炸彈？數十億枚迷你炸彈？還是可能是運輸膠囊，裡面有一個迷你機器人？或致命的硬碟裝置？還是是外星人的卵？或需要解碼的訊息？還是他們全來自於一個更大的生命體？還是其實是需要拼湊的拼圖遊戲？

任務中心團隊反對讓更多錯誤訊息與傳教式的宣傳繼續下去。 一部分原因是它會引起混亂，但主要是因為這會危及我們任務的哲學性原則。 我們只能相信我們的殖民者，並期望最好的狀況發生。

Text: We have to come up with something better.
Translation: 我們得想些更好的辦法。

Text: On-site analysis of the unidentified structure only deepens the mystery. The evidence suggests that the cubes are clearly not a natural phenomenon.
Translation: 對不明結構的現場分析只會加深這個謎團。有證據顯示立方體不是自然現象。

Text:
The insides of the cubes as well as the physical forces behind their levitation remain an enigma. Individual cubes as well as their combined structure retain a perfect symmetry and any attempts to physically disturb their positions have failed.

What is even more puzzling is the analysis of the photonic spectroscopy of the cubes. They seem to emanate radiation of an unknown wavelength which excites the separation of electrons inside of the spectroscopic lens. While our science team refuses to jump to any conclusions, the Chief Engineer suggests that we should study the effect empirically on the Colony’s Solar Panels.

The science team requested permission to commence experimental research on the cubes' properties.

<effect>New research on the mystery of the Black Cubes is now available
Translation:
立方體內部以及支撐它們懸空的物理法則仍然是一團謎，每個立方體以及組合構造皆完美地對稱著，任何在物理上擾亂其形態的嘗試均告失敗。

更令人費解的是立方體的光譜分析結果。它們似乎發出了未知波長的輻射，引發了分光鏡內部電子的解離。 雖然科學團隊拒絕做出任何結論，但總工程師建議我們應該對殖民地太陽能板進行研究。

科學團隊申請立方體屬性實驗研究的許可。

<effect>已可進行新的「黑立方之謎」研究。

Text: We should rearrange our research priorities.
Translation: 我們應重新安排研究的優先序。

Text: Primary analysis of the Black Cubes revealed no conclusive answers. The cubes may somehow affect our Solar Panels. New Breakthrough research is now available.
Translation: 對黑立方的初步分析尚未發現確切的解答，立方體可能以某種方式影響我們的太陽能板。可以進行新的突破性研究了。

Text: Recent orbital scans revealed a sudden surge of energy on site. It’s now evident that the cubes pose a far greater threat than blocking our infrastructure plans.
Translation: 最近的衛星掃描顯示在區域裡有突然增加的能量反應。 很明顯的，立方體對我們的威脅可能不僅僅是阻止我們的建設計劃而已。

Text:
